meanings.sent1: The company's expansionary plans led to the opening of new branches.
meanings.sent2: The balloon's expansionary nature caused it to grow larger.
meanings.sent3: The expansionary cake batter spilled over the edges of the pan.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like an expansionary wave, filling the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The expansionary clouds in the sky signaled an approaching storm.

meanings.definition: Tending to expand or capable of causing expansion
meanings.sent1: The warm air had an expansionary effect on the balloon.
meanings.sent2: The expansionary force of the gas made the balloon rise.
meanings.sent3: The expansionary bubble gum stretched as he blew a big bubble.
meanings.sent4: His expansionary ideas grew rapidly in popularity.
meanings.sent5: The expansionary population growth strained the resources of the town.

meanings.definition: Relating to or promoting economic expansion
meanings.sent1: The government implemented expansionary policies to boost the economy.
meanings.sent2: The expansionary measures resulted in increased job opportunities.
meanings.sent3: The expansionary budget allocation surprised many economists.
meanings.sent4: Her investment had an expansionary impact on the local businesses.
meanings.sent5: The expansionary trade agreements opened up new markets for exports.
